page.title: 18BIOGRAPHY OF A VILLAGER
page.content: { How long have you lived in the {village? 71 years. {Could you tell us somethong of your {school days? I attended Haslington County Primary School until I was 14.As well as lessons in the "three R's" I was taught to cook and sew and boys from another school came to our school to do woodwork once a week. I had to sit a scholarship when it was time for me to leave to decide whether or not I went on to Grammar School. I failed so I left to find employment. {What was your work and conditions? I found employment in Crewe as a printing apprentice earning seven shillings and sixpence a week but by the time I left I was earning 30 shillings a week.
